hours_text:
#  Visit 

Find Yourself Here.

## Hours & Locations

[ Museum ](/about/new-museum)

Free to all.

[ Princeton University Campus ](https://campusmap.princeton.edu/poi/1446/art-museum)

  * **Monday–Wednesday** 10 a.m.–5 p.m.
  * **Thursday–Friday** 10 a.m.–8 p.m.
  * **Saturday** 10 a.m.–5 p.m.
  * **Sunday** 12–5 p.m.

_Closed Thanksgiving Day, Christmas Day, New Years Day, and Fourth of July._

[ Mosaic Restaurant ](/visit/mosaic-restaurant)

Fresh, seasonal, and thoughtfully prepared.

[ Third Floor ](https://campusmap.princeton.edu/poi/1446/art-museum)

  * **Monday** 9 a.m.–3 p.m.
  * **Tuesday–Wednesday** Closed
  * **Thursday–Friday** 9 a.m.–3 p.m.
  * **Saturday–Sunday** 10 a.m.–3 p.m.

[ Museum Store ](/visit/museum-stores)

Collections inspired.

[ First Floor ](https://campusmap.princeton.edu/poi/1446/art-museum)

  * **Monday–Wednesday** 10 a.m.–5:30 p.m.
  * **Thursday–Friday** 10 a.m.–8:30 p.m.
  * **Saturday** 10 a.m.–5:30 p.m.
  * **Sunday** 12–5:30 p.m.

[ Art@Bainbridge ](/visit/artbainbridge)

Contemporary art. Historic building.

[ 158 Nassau Street ](https://campusmap.princeton.edu/poi/237/bainbridge-house)

  * **Monday–Thursday** Closed
  * **Friday–Saturday** 11 a.m.–5 p.m.
  * **Sunday** 12 p.m.–5 p.m.

[ Museum Store in Palmer Square ](/visit/museum-stores)

Corner store. Regional artisans. World of art.

[ Palmer Square ](https://campusmap.princeton.edu/poi/546/art-museum-store)

  * **Monday–Thursday** 10 a.m.–6 p.m.
  * **Friday** 10 a.m.–7 p.m.
 ...

accessibility_text:
#  Accessibility Help 

## Help with disability-related IT issues

  * [Report an information technology barrier](http://web.archive.org/web/20260117080950/https://digital.accessibility.princeton.edu/help)

## Help with logins and passwords

  * Call 609-258-4357
  * Contact the [Service Desk](http://web.archive.org/web/20260117080950/https://princeton.service-now.com/service?id=kb_article&sys_id=352a27064f9ca20018ddd48e5210c730)

## Questions about admission & financial aid

  * [Undergraduate admission](http://web.archive.org/web/20260117080950/https://admission.princeton.edu/)
  * [Graduate admission](http://web.archive.org/web/20260117080950/https://gradschool.princeton.edu/)

## Questions about parking, routes & transit

  * [Campus access](/web/20260117080950/https://accessibility.princeton.edu/campus)

#  Accessibility Help
collections_text:
## What's happening

[ Museum Exhibition Princeton Collects _Princeton Collects_ celebrates the gifts and promised gifts of more than 2,000 works of art committed by more than two hundred donors on the occasion of the new Museum facility. October 31, 2025–March 29, 2026  Learn more ](/exhibitions-events/exhibitions/princeton-collects) [ Museum Exhibition Toshiko Takaezu: Dialogues in Clay _Toshiko Takaezu: Dialogues in Clay_ presents the work of the groundbreaking ceramic artist Toshiko Takaezu (1922–2011), who taught at Princeton University for almost three decades. October 31, 2025–July 5, 2026  Learn more ](/exhibitions-events/exhibitions/toshiko-takaezu-dialogues-clay)

## Stories

> The act of constructing a wholly new facility at the historic center of our campus is a testament to Princeton’s belief that a museum can and should play a fundamental role in the education of future generations.
> 
> Museum Director James Steward

[ Read the Director's Letter ](/about/directors-welcome/rebirth-museum)

[ Article  Celebrating American Art at Princeton By Christine Minerva  January 5, 2026  ](/art/stories-perspectives/celebrating-american-art-princeton) [ Article  Inaugural Exhibition Explores the Legacy of Toshiko Takaezu By Samuel Shapiro  November 17, 2025  ](/art/stories-perspectives/inaugural-exhibition-explores-legacy-toshiko-takaezu) [ Article  _Princeton Collects_ Showcases New Gifts to the Museum  By James Steward  November 17, 2025  ](/art/stories-perspectives/prince...
